This article from @zephoria continues to feel prescient:

"I don’t have access to the #Twitter social graph these days, but I’d bet my bottom dollar that it would indicate whether or not the site was on a trajectory towards collapse.

We are certainly seeing entire sub-networks flock to #Mastodon….You can lose whole segments and not lose a site. However, if those departing are creating Swiss cheese into the network graph, then I would worry."

In the chaos around #NLP, I went back and re-read the beautiful article by Lawrence Barsalou on the function of language in human cognition.

Barsalou argues that language evolved in humans to support coordinated action. Archival function of language is secondary. He highlights that #CognitiveScience #Linguistics has largely studied the secondary function and making minimal advances on the the primary.

#AI, #ML, #NLP have a similar bias.

Paper: https://barsaloulab.org/Online_Articles/1999-Barsalou-DP-situated_comprehension.pdf

Let's now talk about search on #Calckey.

To be bluntly honest, Fediverse search needs a lot of work. I don't think one server software nails it yet.

However, unlike Mastodon, Calckey allows you to search across the Fediverse without need of hashtags (or for you to have interacted with the post previously).

This makes search a lot more extensible than on Mastodon.

Click this link to see it in action:

https://calckey.social/search?q=notifications

Also see screenshot.

Are you using the https://keepachangelog.com format? Don't make the common mistake of putting useless square brackets around the version number.

The square brackets are Markdown reference-style links. If you aren't putting diff links into your changelog, you should leave out the square brackets.

If you're trying to sign up for https://calckey.social, you may have noticed there's a notice saying that registrations are disabled *above* the registration form. This notice is not accurate.

It is actually a bug, and I've filed it as one in the repo:

https://codeberg.org/calckey/calckey/issues/10033

If you want to join https://calckey.social, *ignore* that notice and continue with your registration.

Here's a screenshot of the bug in question.

See also: https://calckey.social/notes/9eegkseedn

#EliotCutler twice ran for governor of #Maine (2010 and 2014), each time as an independent liberal, each time undercutting the #Democratic candidate and handing victory to the #Republican proto-Trumpist #PaulLePage. title: Six Centuries of Type & Printing (letterpress and ebook bundle)

last_post.content: Back in 2020, I published Six Centuries of Type & Printing, a concise book – 64 pages – that actually starts centuries before Gutenberg, with Chinese and Korea printing, and then digs into 1450 to 2020, covering ~600 years of technological advances. Set in hot-metal type (Monotype Bembo) in North Yorkshire, printed in London, and bound in Germany with a foil-stamped cover & slipcase, I still have copies available for shipping worldwide! https://glog.glennf.com/tiny-type-museum-time-capsule-and-more/six-centuries-letterpress (ebook edition available)

title: [Theory] Jar Jar Binks was a trained Force user, knowing Sith collaborator, and will play a central role in The Force Awakens

last_post.content:
On this May the 4th, let's remember that the greatest and most misunderstood character in all of Star Wars canon, Jar Jar Binks, was secretly a trained Force user and probably a Sith Lord, but we'll never know because you nerds hated so much on him that George Lucas lost his nerve and dropped him from the rest of the trilogy, except for that one scene he kept in Revenge of the Sith where Jar Jar straight up legislates the Empire into being and you sheeple never made the connection.

https://www.reddit.com/r/StarWars/comments/3qvj6w/theory_jar_jar_binks_was_a_trained_force_user/
